text_section1.text: I was in the tropics, visiting my friend Dr. Harry Cross, at the plantation...

text_section2.text: Ants are fascinating creatures, Jack! As an ex-army officer, you'd be interested in studying their military prowess!

text_section1.text: Yeah, I recall back home they had special ants brought in to combat boll weevils!

text_section2.text: That's roughly my job here! I'm to determine which ants are good for the plantation and which are bad!

text_section1.text: The good ones will remain... but the bad ones will have to be driven off with some smoke bombs! A load of these bombs will arrive by jeep tonight!

text_section2.text: War against the ants, eh? That should be interesting!

text_section1.text: And that's how, quite simply, it all began! Little did I know that by nightfall, I would be able to say what no man could ever say... that I was...

text_section2.text: King of the Ants

text_section1.text: Doc, these little fellows are absolutely fascinating!

text_section2.text: The more you study them, the more you become intrigued by them!

text_section3.text: Doctor Cross! The plantation is being attacked by raiders!

text_section1.text: The raiders were coastal bandits who swept down in hordes upon unsuspecting plantations...

text_section2.text: Doc, from the sound of the gunfire, I'd say there aren't too many of them!

text_section3.text: Right, Jack! They're a scouting party sent to pin us down until the main party arrives!

text_section1.text: But even their scout party outnumbers the men we have here!

text_section2.text: I've been with troops in battle who were outnumbered but somehow came through! Gather your men! I'll round up all the weapons we have on hand!

text_section1.text: As I raced back through the lab a shot exploded some vials on the shelf above me...
Something in the chemicals seemed to weaken me, and I leaned on the lab bench! I found myself staring fixedly at the scurrying ants...

text_section2.text: Odd... very odd! I feel strange... different! Something's happening to me! Maybe something caused by the chemicals...

text_section1.text: I strained to call out for Doc Cross but couldn't utter a single murmur... and I seemed to be getting smaller...
And still smaller...
smaller... smaller... smaller!

text_section2.text: Doc! Doc! Where are you? Great guns! What's happened to me?

text_section1.text: I heard strange, almost musical humming sounds and then I saw them too late... the ants!

text_section2.text: I've shrunk to microscope size! I'm smaller even than the ants! And, by harry, they're making me prisoner!

text_section1.text: I was as helpless as a rag doll in a child's clutches! But then their grip suddenly relaxed... and I saw why...

text_section2.text: A beetle! But it's not the small insect I normally knew! It's as big as a rhino right now! And its got the ants worried!

text_section1.text: The ants were few in number... merely a patrol... and were no match for the oncoming beetle... and neither was I a match for it, unless...

text_section2.text: ... unless I can make a workable sword out of this thorn!

text_section1.text: With thorn-spear in hand, I climbed upon a raised twig, raced along to a point above the beetle, then leaped...

text_section2.text: What I wouldn't give for an M-1 rifle or a grenade now! Captain Jack Flaherty, U.S. infantry, fighting with a thorn!

text_section1.text: I landed with a crash atop the beetle, barely missing the poised pincers, and through the thorn spear was broken, it had done its work!

text_section2.text: The strange humming sound! It's changed its tone! What are they up to now?

text_section1.text: Once again they took hold of me, but more gently this time..
And they bore me away now not as their prisoner, but as a friend!

text_section2.text: Yes! I've become their champion!

text_section1.text: They bore me to their colony, where I was received by the others with loud humming acclaim!
Following a brief `parade' I was placed in what appeared to be a throne-room!

text_section2.text: Great guns! Now I understand! They're making me their king!

text_section1.text: For food, I was brought tasty honey and other tidbits which I didn't recognize, but enjoyed...
I witnessed them at work... saw how they built roads by removing obstacles in their path...

text_section2.text: They have tremendous strength... and uncanny intelligence!

text_section1.text: And I led them on hunting forays...

text_section2.text: That rabbit's as big as a dinosaur... and the bird as big as a roc!

text_section1.text: Then I knew what made the bird take to wing... and the rabbit scurry away! Coming toward us were those dreaded raiders of the insect world... the mighty driver ants!

text_section2.text: The raider ants will wipe out our entire colony! We haven't got a chance!

text_section1.text: But then I witnessed unusual strategy! My ant friends were gathering choice morsels and placing them in the path of the driver army!

text_section2.text: It wouldn't even take army training to see through what they're up to!

text_section1.text: The enemy fights over the morsels... giving my friends time to bring up their main force!
But I knew there was no time for that, so I hurriedly went about starting a small fire by striking stones together...

text_section2.text: Here's where I can help out again! Start a fire... and set the dry moss ablaze!

text_section1.text: The wind is just right! (cough) (cough) and the smoke's turning them back!
Jack! Jack! Are you all right?
I came to, suddenly... back in the lab... back to normal size...

text_section2.text: Thank heavens! The chemicals were harmless! Hurry, Jack... the guns! We need guns! The main raider party will be here soon!

text_section3.text: Raiders? Sure! Look, Doc! Don't ask questions! Get every possible thing of value on the plantation! I've got a plan...

text_section1.text: We took money, jewelry, trinkets... made our way into the jungle, and flung it in the path of the oncoming raiders...

text_section2.text: Jack! Your strategy's working! They're fighting over the valuables! That'll give us precious time!

text_section1.text: Yes, we got our precious time, and when the jeep arrived with the smoke bombs, we routed the raiders just as I had seen other raiders routed once before!

text_section2.text: Your military training sure saved us, Jack!

text_section3.text: Yes... military training learned in the strangest army I've ever known!

text_section1.text: Later, when I told Doc Cross my phenomenal experiences in that far, faraway world!

text_section2.text: Of course, the chemicals could have brought on a sort of delirium that made you dream all that, or maybe it was a sort of self-hyponosis brought on by your fascination with the ants!

text_section3.text: Don't burst a beautiful bubble, doc! I like to think I was there! After all... who does't like to be a king, even for a day?

text_section4.text: And you can bet your bottom dollar on one thing! I'm sure careful nowadays about stepping on ants... any ants!
